questions.question: Which of the following best describes the role of Prolog in the Axone protocol?
answers: Prolog is primarily used for front-end development within the Axone ecosystem, focusing on user interface design and experience.
Prolog serves as a database management system in Axone, handling the storage, retrieval, and update of data within the protocol.
Prolog is employed as an on-chain module within Axone, interpreting rules related to governance and consent, and ensuring secure and reliable decentralized decision-making.
Prolog functions as a cryptocurrency wallet in the Axone protocol, managing digital assets and facilitating transactions between users.

questions.question: How does the Axone protocol handle the dynamic nature of resource management?
answers: Through Dynamic Rule Updates in real-time.
By allowing only manual updates to rules.
By relying on a centralized system for adaptation.

questions.question: What is the role of hierarchy of norms in Axone resource consents?
answers: It establishes the order of precedence among different norms.

questions.question: In Prolog, what is the declarative style?
answers: Specifying how to achieve a task
Describing relationships and rules without step-by-step instructions.
Ignoring logical inferenceIt establishes the order of precedence among different norms.
